Logging

Interface ILogger

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FileLogger, TraceLogger

    public interface ILogger
    A Logger object is used to log messages for a specific system or application component. To organize all log messages a logger provides methods for creating log messages and handles the organization intern. The structure of a entry in the log file is delegated to the class implementing this interface. All Logger, an ILoggerFactory provides, are based on this Interface.

    A logger is identified by his name. Therefore the name for a logger should be unique in a project. A similar approach is used in Logger.

    To give the log-file a structure, the listed messages are divided in three levels: Info, Warning and Error.

    • Info - An information, which could be helpful for debugging. Even many messages could be useful for debugging it is recommended to use it rarely.
    • Warning - A message to give notice that something unexpected has happened.
    • Error - An error, which occurred while executing. Necessary for debugging.
    Every logger provides methods for each of this message-levels.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    9045534
    See Also:
    ILoggerFactory, Logger

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the loggers name.
        Returns:
        name of the logger

      • info

        void info(java.lang.String msg)
        Writes a message on the level INFO in the log file. It should be used for any message which could be helpful for debugging.
        Parameters:
        msg - Description/Message of the information

      • warning

        void warning(java.lang.String msg)
        Writes a message on the level WARNING in the log file. It should be used for unexpected events.
        Parameters:
        msg - Description/Message of the warning
        See Also:
        warning(String, Exception)

      • warning

        void warning(java.lang.String msg,
             @Nullable
             java.lang.Exception thrownException)
        Writes a message on the level WARNING in the log file. It should be used for unexpected events.
        Parameters:
        msg - Description/Message of the warning
        thrownException - Exception, which was thrown. If no exception was thrown, use warning(String) instead.
        See Also:
        warning(String)

      • error

        void error(java.lang.String msg)
        Writes a message on the level ERROR in the log file. It should be used for any error in the project.
        Parameters:
        msg - Description/Message of the error
